author: Special Correspondent
text:
The Delhi High Court on Monday directed the Delhi government to file the status report on a petition moved by the former Haryana Chief Minister Om Prakash Chautala lodged in Tihar Central Jail here, seeking 60 days’ parole for his treatment. Mr. Chautala is undergoing a 10-year prison term following his conviction in the teachers’ recruitment scam case.

The Bench of Justice Ashutosh Kumar asked the Delhi government to submit the status report by January 29 on Mr. Chautala’s plea taking exception to the Home Department’s rejection of his parole application on October 20. The Home Department had stated that there should be a gap of a minimum of six months from the date of termination of the last parole.

The petition filed by Mr. Chautala, 82, said he was polio-affected and had permanent disability of 60 per cent.
title: HC seeks status report on Chautala’s parole plea
